alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 6:33PM MDT until June 16 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected near the headwaters of the Pecos River, including Cowles and Tererro. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Santa Fe. In northeast New Mexico, Mora and San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 633 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pecos, Cowles and Tererro. - This includes the following recreation areas... Field Tract Campground, Holy Ghost Campground, Iron Gate Campground, Jacks Creek Campground, Panchuela Campground, Willow Creek Campground, Bert Clancy Wildlife Area, Mora River Picnic Area and Lisboa Springs Fish Hatchery. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
